interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2017/02/11
Average Rating: 4.0
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Didier Le Pêcheur'], 'Producers': ['Clementine Dabadie'], 'Starring': ['Mathilde Seigner'], 'Studio': ['Under The Milky Way']}
Review Text: I did not read nor I was aware of the book the movie is based on.  However, this movie works great taking you with its charm and quirkiness, wondering how it will develop. As soon as you feel invested in the story and its characters, it becomes a real downer of a movie.
Review Title: Not what it seems...
Rating: 2.0
--------------------------------------------------

A gem!

{'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Michael Spierig', 'Peter Spierig'], 'Producers': ['Patrick McDonald', 'Tim McGahan'], 'Starring': ['Ethan Hawke', 'Sarah Snook', 'Noah Taylor'], 'Studio': ['Vertical Entertainment']}
Damn!  That's all I was able to say just right now as I finished watching.  Great take in cause/effect, choices, and indeed the question if we are pre-destined to a fate. I have to say, soon after the film starts there's like 45minutes or so that can feel like an eternity as it's very slow while a very long conversation b/w the characters takes place, but it sets up the rest beautifully.  Totally worth it.  Ethan Hawke gave a great performance.  Hats off to him.
Hats off to Ethan Hawke

1 1/2 stars at best.  It showed a lot of promise within the first few minutes but once it gets into the story line, it absolutely tanks.  Gotta wonder about who wrote those 5 stars reviews, that coincidentally were all written within a day or two of each other.
Totally tanks

This movie went nowhere really really fast.  The main character's personality is so stiff and dry is not even funny.  I was fooled  after having seen the preview.  A real disappointment.

The Bounty Hunter
Comedy, Romance, Exciting, Passionate
['A bounty hunter learns that his next target is his ex-wife.']
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Andy Tennant'], 'Producers': ['Neal Moritz'], 'Starring': ['Jennifer Aniston', 'Gerard Butler', 'Christine Baranski']}
Movie started good, got stuck on neutral in the middle, and painfully flopped to the end.  I really enjoy Aniston's character's - maybe it's just her I really like, but that's not here not there - Movie could've used better writing.  Acting was overall okay.  They were just strapped to a poor script.  Though, comedy is not Butler's forte.  Editing was also very suspect.  This is one of those movies where less would've been more -way more.  I barely made it to the end.  Three stars is really generous.  Trailer had movie expectations way higher.  Too bad.
Disappointing
French Kiss
Meg Ryan  (Actor),     Kevin Kline  (Actor),     Lawrence Kasidan  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, All Fox Titles
['Meg Ryan ("Sleepless in Seattle") and Kevin Kline ("Dave") star in this bouncy romantic comedy about life, love and larceny. When her Fiancé is smitten by a beautiful Frenchwoman, Kate (Ryan) flies to Paris determined to win him back. However, nothing prepares her for Luc (Kline), a cunning sexy Frenchman with a gift for gab and a fondness for thievery. A self-proclaimed expert on affairs of the heart, Luc promises to help Kate win back her man. But one star-crossed misadventure after another sweeps them across France, ultimately changing them in ways they never dreamed possible.']
{'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'Color, Widescreen, Dolby, Closed-captioned, Surround Sound', 'Contributor': 'Timothy Hutton, Jean Reno, Meg Ryan, Lawrence Kasidan, Kevin Kline', 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 51 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '2000137', 'Director': 'Lawrence Kasidan', 'Media Format': 'Color, Widescreen, Dolby, Closed-captioned, Surround Sound', 'Run time': '1 hour and 51 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 14, 2003', 'Actors': 'Meg Ryan, Kevin Kline, Timothy Hutton, Jean Reno', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish', 'Studio': '20th Century Fox', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Love the movie, hate the DVD quality.  Movie has a purple/yellow line on the left side of the screen.  I returned it and got a new replacement copy...with the very same issue!  another reviewer mentioned same issue. Must be a manufacturing issue with this new release.  Also no true widescreen.  Really disappointed.
Bad DVD quality.

This movie had me intoxicated flying as a kite. Wish I had a some wine while watching it. Thoroughly enjoyed it. Though, the final scene brought me crashing down to earth... I would've stayed floating up in the clouds...

profile:
User Profile Summary:

- **Rating Tendencies:** The user's average rating has further decreased to 4.5, reflecting a continued critical perspective on film execution. The recent review marked by a lower rating emphasizes their growing dissatisfaction with narrative development, highlighting a discrepancy between initial engagement and thematic resolution.

- **Content Preferences:** The user values mature themes and high production value but is becoming increasingly discerning, particularly regarding story development. Their latest interaction reveals a conflicting experience, where initial charm gave way to disappointment, suggesting a desire for consistent narrative satisfaction.

- **Language Barrier:** The user maintains a preference for content in their native language but is still receptive to English audio and subtitles, supporting their engagement with diverse content.

- **Genre Affinity:** Their affinity for drama and character-driven narratives persists, with a hesitation towards romantic comedies that may not meet their narrative expectations. Emotional depth combined with a coherent story arc remains crucial.

- **Director Influence:** The user continues to respect directors who prioritize script quality and emotional resonance, underscored by their reaction to recent films that missed fulfilling conclusions despite promising setups.

- **Positive Attitude:** While still enthusiastic about storytelling, the user is increasingly critical, balancing enjoyment with a demand for narrative integrity and production quality, as evidenced by their recent dissatisfaction with a film's conclusion.

In summary, the user is navigating content quality with a sharpened critical lens, seeking engaging narratives that maintain both emotional depth and satisfactory resolutions.
